channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Couple found guilty of assaulting maid, who was abused from her first day of work
item.description:
June 09, 2020 2:52 PM

SINGAPORE - A woman slapped and punched her domestic helper who was on her first day of work.

item.title: Nanyang Poly revamps teaching by doing away with subject boundaries
item.description:
June 09, 2020 1:11 PM

SINGAPORE - A polytechnic is introducing changes in its teaching approach that will see students work on projects that involve several subjects and skills from the get-go, similar to what employees in industry have to go through.

item.title: Two men charged with flying drones without permit; one allegedly took aerial videos of military base
item.description:
June 09, 2020 1:09 PM

SINGAPORE - Two men were charged on Tuesday morning (June 9) with flying their drones without a permit.

item.title: Dengue cases surge past 10,000, with 872 infections last week alone
item.description:
June 09, 2020 12:31 PM

This is the largest outbreak year recorded in Singapore's recent history, said NEA.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on June 9
item.description:
June 09, 2020 7:45 AM

Good morning! Here are our top stories to kick-start your Tuesday, June 9.

item.title: Ex-ICA man jailed for false complaint against ex-supervisor
item.description:
June 09, 2020 5:00 AM

A 30-year-old man was jailed for 10 weeks yesterday for sending an e-mail falsely stating that his former supervisor at the Immigration and Checkpoints Authority (ICA) could have taken photos of another man in a public toilet.

item.title: Charities face new fund-raising reality amid pandemic
item.description:
June 09, 2020 5:00 AM

Three-course gourmet dinner, check. Performance by theatre group Wild Rice, check.

item.title: SIA secures $10b in liquidity to combat coronavirus fallout
item.description:
June 09, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore Airlines (SIA) has secured $10 billion in fresh liquidity through its recent rights issue as well as through other credit facilities, as the airline industry navigates an unprecedented crisis caused by the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: $400k donated to help 1,500 households in South East District
item.description:
June 09, 2020 5:00 AM

About 1,500 households in the South East District that have been hard hit by the Covid-19 situation will benefit from a donation of $350,000 by non-profit organisation Business China, and an additional $50,000 from South East Community Development Council (CDC).

item.title: New screening centres set up to support expanded virus testing
item.description:
June 09, 2020 5:00 AM

As more activities resume and people start interacting more freely, there could be an "inevitable" rise in the number of new Covid-19 cases in the coming weeks.

item.title: Saving the earth with dried detergent
item.description:
June 09, 2020 5:00 AM

Just add water. That is the simple but creative solution by Mr Clewyn Puah, 26, and Mr Jeremy Lee, 27, two entrepreneurs who hope their "detergent tablet" will replace dishwashing liquid in wasteful large plastic bottles.

item.title: Seven more places added to list visited by Covid-19 cases
item.description:
June 09, 2020 5:00 AM

Seven more places were added yesterday to the Ministry of Health's (MOH) list of places visited by Covid-19 cases while they were infectious.

item.title: 3,231 more HDB lifts to get safety upgrade this year
item.description:
June 09, 2020 5:00 AM

About 3,200 more lifts across Singapore will be enhanced with better safety features such as high-tech sensors to monitor the lift speed and an emergency communications system this year.

item.title: S'pore residents returning from China have to stay home for 14 days
item.description:
June 09, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore residents returning from China under the new "fast lane" agreement between the two countries will have to stay at home for 14 days.

item.title: Ex-lawyer took photos of woman's underwear, chest
item.description:
June 09, 2020 5:00 AM

A former lawyer with top legal firm Drew & Napier changed his mind on contesting charges against him of insulting his then colleague's modesty.

item.title: Challenge of keeping S'pore together amid crisis: DPM
item.description:
June 09, 2020 5:00 AM

The coming general election will chart the course Singapore takes not just for the next few months, but for at least the next five to 10 years, Deputy Prime Minister Heng Swee Keat said yesterday.

item.title: 100 large flying foxes spotted on World Environment Day
item.description:
June 09, 2020 5:00 AM

World Environment Day, which falls on June 5 every year, was made more memorable in Singapore with a rare sighting last Friday: a colony of over 100 large flying foxes soaring over the Central Catchment Nature Reserve.

item.title: Number of tests fluctuates daily based on group to be tested
item.description:
June 09, 2020 5:00 AM

The number of Covid-19 tests carried out may fluctuate from day to day, depending on which group of people is scheduled to be tested, the Ministry of Health's (MOH) director of medical services Kenneth Mak said yesterday.

item.title: Covid-19 'stress test' reveals social capital is strong in Singapore: Heng
item.description:
June 09, 2020 5:00 AM

Singaporeans' willingness to adapt and respond to new advice as fresh medical evidence surfaces on Covid-19 shows the country has the social capital to emerge stronger from the pandemic and deal with future crises, said Deputy Prime Minister Heng Swee Keat.

item.title: PM Lee's defamation suit against blogger to be heard next month
item.description:
June 09, 2020 5:00 AM

The defamation suit brought by Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong against financial adviser and blogger Leong Sze Hian is set to be heard in the High Court from July 6 to 10.

item.title: Coronavirus: Cross-border travel talks with Malaysia under way but safety still a priority
item.description:
June 09, 2020 5:00 AM

The resumption of travel in a safe way "would mean looking at testing protocols in place on both sides before the travellers can come back and forth".

item.title: Wong: Community cases up but situation under control
item.description:
June 09, 2020 5:00 AM

Community cases have increased a week after the end of Singapore's circuit breaker period but the situation remains under control, Minister for National Development Lawrence Wong said yesterday.

item.title: S'pore, France agree to keep open flow of essential food supplies
item.description:
June 09, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore and France have agreed to maintain open and connected supply chains for essential food supplies during the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Distancing, mask wearing crucial despite mass testing, says task force
item.description:
June 09, 2020 5:00 AM

Even as Singapore rolls out mass testing of its population for Covid-19, safe measures like distancing and mask wearing remain critical to preventing the spread of the coronavirus, said the multi-ministry task force tackling the virus yesterday.

item.title: National Chinese Challenge 2020 to be held online
item.description:
June 09, 2020 5:00 AM

An inter-school competition that tests Chinese language skills will be held online for the first time in its seven-year history.

item.title: Contact tracing device to be rolled out this month
item.description:
June 09, 2020 5:00 AM

A new contact tracing device will be rolled out from the second half of this month, as the authorities step up efforts to curb the spread of Covid-19.

item.title: Probation for youth who took photos of men showering
item.description:
June 09, 2020 5:00 AM

A teenager snapped pictures of men showering in toilets at the Nanyang Technological University (NTU) campus on two separate occasions last year.

item.title: No need to avoid places visited by Covid-19 patients, says Gan
item.description:
June 09, 2020 5:00 AM

There is no need to worry about going to venues that Covid-19 patients have visited as these places are safe, Health Minister Gan Kim Yong said yesterday.

item.title: Q3 hiring outlook among Singapore employers weakest since 2009: Survey
item.description:
June 09, 2020 2:44 AM

Out of 266 firms polled during the circuit breaker period, 38 per cent expect headcount to fall in the July to September quarter, compared to the current quarter.

item.title: Coronavirus: Singapore residents returning from China to serve 14-day stay-home notice
item.description:
June 09, 2020 12:00 AM

If they keep to this and other terms of the agreement, they will not need to pay coronavirus-related medical bills at public hospitals.
